alert.note: Alert for Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk (New York) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS New York City - Upton (Long Island and New York City)
info.headline: Coastal Flood Statement issued September 28 at 12:24PM EDT until September 30 at 2:00AM EDT by NWS New York City - Upton
info.description: ...COASTAL FLOOD STATEMENT REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 PM EDT THIS EVENING THROUGH LATE FRIDAY NIGHT... * WHAT...Up to 1/2 ft of inundation above ground level expected in vulnerable areas near the waterfront and shoreline. * WHERE...Northwest Suffolk, Northeast Suffolk and Northern Nassau Counties. * WHEN...From 10 PM EDT this evening through late Friday night. * COASTAL FLOOD IMPACTS...Brief minor flooding of the most vulnerable locations near the waterfront and shoreline along Peconic and Gardiners Bay, including the Peconic River. * SHORELINE IMPACTS...Breaking waves of 2 to 3 ft on the north shore of Long Island, and 3 to 5 ft at Orient Point will result in beach erosion and flooding and possible localized dune erosion. Splashover bulkheads and dune structures may locally exacerbate flooding for shoreline roads and properties. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Additional rounds of localized minor coastal flooding are possible during the times of high tide this weekend.
info.instruction: Do not drive through flooded roadways.

area.areaDesc: Northeast Suffolk; Northern Nassau; Northwest Suffolk
